website_summaries.verdict: A top choice in a warm and comfortable snow boot that tends to run on the small side.
pros: Praised for their high quality materials and excellent construction, these boots stand out with their good insulation and capable traction
They also get top marks for being easy to get on and off, thanks to the special tabs at the back of the boot
cons: Most customers say these boots run small, so consider ordering a size up
Some reports of water leaking into the boot

customer_reviews.title: Standing, hiking or working.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly out of the box. Very warm, sturdy, supportive sole. Good traction on icy pavement. You can ignore cold while standing still in low temperatures. I recommend a good quality wool sock to keep your feet dry. I wear Materials : 75% Merino wool , 20% Nylon , 3% Polyester , 2% Lycra. A cotton sock will not wick dry your feet if you are spending too much time indoors. Tried both the first two days. Wool wins hands down. Oh, BTW, the wool socks were by Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Ahlman

customer_reviews.title: True to size fit
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, warm, and dry, this is exactly what I wanted in a winter boot. If you're unaccustomed to wearing boots or simply haven't worn a pair in a while be aware that it does take time to break these in. They're very stiff at first but after wearing them for a few days they're already much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot but not very wide

product_meta.description: This super-warm boot features 200G insulation, thermal-reflective liners and is rated at -25F/-and 32C, perfect for building snowmen, and also pretty great for kicking them over and stomping them into extra snowballs for the fight that said action might trigger. Play fair, play safe. But above all, play

Techlite lightweight midsole for comfort, cushioning, and high energy return.
